segments.en: Numbered Discourses 6
2. Warm-hearted
15. Regret

segments.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There Sāriputta addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “tathā tathāvuso, bhikkhu vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā anutappā hoti.
segments.en: “As a mendicant makes their bed, so they must lie in it, and die tormented by regrets.

segments.pli: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā anutappā hoti?
segments.en: And how do they die tormented by regrets?

segments.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu kammārāmo hoti kammarato kammārāmataṃ anuyutto, bhassārāmo hoti …
segments.en: Take a mendicant who relishes work, talk, sleep, company, closeness, and proliferation. They love these things and like to relish them.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā anutappā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant who makes their bed like this must lie in it, and die tormented by regrets.
This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu sakkāyābhirato nappajahāsi sakkāyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya’.
segments.en: a mendicant who enjoys identity, who hasn’t given up identity to rightly make an end of suffering.

segments.pli: Tathā tathāvuso, bhikkhu vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā ananutappā hoti.
segments.en: As a mendicant makes their bed, so they must lie in it, and die free of regrets.

segments.pli: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā ananutappā hoti?
segments.en: And how do they die free of regrets?

segments.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu na kammārāmo hoti na kammarato na kammārāmataṃ anuyutto, na bhassārāmo hoti …
segments.en: Take a mendicant who doesn’t relish work, talk, sleep, company, closeness, and proliferation. They don’t love these things or like to relish them.

segments.pli: na papañcārāmo hoti na papañcarato na papañcārāmataṃ anuyutto.
Evaṃ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā ananutappā hoti.
segments.en: A mendicant who makes their bed like this must lie in it, and die free of regrets.
This is called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu nibbānābhirato pajahāsi sakkāyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’ti.
segments.en: a mendicant who delights in extinguishment, who has given up identity to rightly make an end of suffering.
A beast who likes to proliferate,
enjoying proliferation,
fails to win extinguishment,
the supreme sanctuary.
But one who gives up proliferation,
enjoying the state of non-proliferation,
wins extinguishment,
the supreme sanctuary.”

suttaplex.blurb: A mendicant who lives well and doesn’t waste time dies without regret.
